page.title: 07Pembroke Dockyard Part 2
page.content: sea-plane base in the world.The naval side of it revived a little with their work on the mile wide submarine net which spanned the Haven.In 1960 the R.A.F.left the dockyard and it began to run down once more.It's main present day function is to service the missile range at Aberporth.There are now just 170 people employed there,with only 1 naval officer and various civilians such as engineers,shipwrights,carpenters,fitte rs and riggers.There is also a special diving unit(see next page).In spite of it's rundown the jetty is still used on 320 days of the year and with the Â£4,000,000 a year it costs to run and the average salary of Â£200 per week it is still a very important contributor to the economy and way of life of the town of Pembroke Dock.
